Posts.Content: L67 wrote: Hello..first time to site: I'm 42 and was called by my Breast Care center to return due to an abnormal mammogram.The film showed dense breast tissue with a possible nodule. I need to return for magnified films with a Ultrasound follow up. What could this mean? What happens next if both test show positive findings? Very scared and unsure......any guidance and suggestions are greatly appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just need an answer/reassurance L67 CaliforniaKate
Just need an answer/reassurance L67 CaliforniaKate

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2007 06:16AM L67 wrote: Thank you all that responded: Second mammogram inclusive-tissue it very dense with no clear finding.I had an immediate reading with a consultation with the Radiologist who explain to me that there is a lot of "stuff" in the tissue,unclear on what this "stuff" is,it is not clear on the films, so an Ultrasound has been schedule in two days to help better define the findings. Thank you all for kind words and support.
Posts.Title: Just need an answer/reassurance L67 CaliforniaKate

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2007 07:21AM L67 wrote: Ultrasound confirmed today a 1.2cm mass in the right breat tissue against the chest wall: Per radiologist they feel it is a fibroademona because of the size, very clear and define outline (looks like a black hole on the Ultrasound)with clear tissue under it reflecting possible fluid. Next step though is a surgical consult with a possible biospy or removal: I just want answers to what this is. Patience right now for me is not a virtue.
